intro: Meibomia wislizeni, commonly known as the wislizeni meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia wislizeni thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
